head.title: Berlin to Send Soviet Union $480 Million Food Stockpile

identified-content.classifier: Top/News/World/Countries and Territories/Russia and the Former Soviet Union

hedline.hl1: Berlin to Send Soviet Union $480 Million Food Stockpile

block.p: Berlin said today that a huge stockpile of food built up by West Berlin in case of a cold war crisis would be sent to help the Soviet Union, the power that once blockaded the city.
Berlin said it was ready to send the 300,000 metric tons of food and other supplies worth $480 million to its former enemy.
The only outstanding question was how to move the goods from 280 warehouses across the city to their destination.
West Berlin established its emergency stockpile in 1953, four years after enduring a yearlong blockade of the enclave city by the Soviet Union and its East German ally.
